conclusion: Two particles, A and B, are placed on the same horizontal plane and start moving in a straight line simultaneously from rest, from the same position, and in the same direction.
The v-t (velocity-time) graph of their motion is shown in the figure.
The task is to find the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases.
Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to 2v₀.
Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to v₀.

premise: Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to 2v₀.
conclusion: For A: a_A = Δv / Δt = (2v₀ – 0) / t₀ = 2v₀ / t₀

premise: Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to v₀.
conclusion: For B: a_B = Δv / Δt = (v₀ – 0) / (5t₀) = v₀ / (5t₀)

premise: For A: a_A = 2v₀ / t₀ and For B: a_B = v₀ / (5t₀)
The slope of the v-t graph represents acceleration.
conclusion: The ratio of the accelerations of A and B is 2:1.
